explanation.text:
Explanation
F = ma

Therefore, a = \(\frac{F}{m}\)

a = \(\frac{7.5 \times 10^{3}}{0.025}\)

a = 3 x 105m/s2

using V2 = U2 + 2ax; 

V2 = 02 + (2 x 3 x 105 x 0.15)

Therefore V = 300 m/s

Velocity \(\alpha \sqrt{temperature}\)

\(\frac{V_1}{V_2} = \sqrt{\frac{T_1}{T_2}}\)

therefore, \(\frac{360}{V_2} = \sqrt{\frac{27 + 273}{127 + 273}}\)

\(V_2 = 240\sqrt{3}\)m/s

explanation.text:
Explanation
Power x time = mgh

120 x 20 = 80 x 10 x h

2400 = 800h

making h the subject of formula,divide both side by 800

\(\frac{2400}{800}\) = h

h = 3m

= 1.4 x 106Nm-2

explanation.text:
Explanation
n = \(\frac {\text{real depth}}{\text {apparent depth}{}}\)

n = \(\frac {t}{t-d}\) 

\(\frac{t - d}{1}\) = \(\frac{t}{n}\)

-d = \(\frac{t}{n}\) - t 

d = - \(\frac{t}{n}\) + t

d = t - \(\frac{t}{n}\)

d =t (1 - \(\frac{1}{n}\))

F = +ve

v = -ve

30 = \(\frac {25 {\times} (-v)}{25 - (-v)}\)
v = \(\frac {25 {\times} (-v)}{25+v}\)
v = 14cm
(Note that either negative or positive values go to show the positioning and hence, they are not a strong necessity in your final answer.)
